newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat ends weak on harvest, Iraq cancellation.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat ends weak on harvest, Iraq cancellation.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures settled weaker on a mixture of harvest pressure, news that Iraq canceled a purchase of U.S. wheat and improved crop conditions, traders said.

"Harvest continues to expand in Texas, and there's talk that parts of southern Oklahoma will be coming on line this weekend," a KCBT trader said. "Plus, the market was disappointed at the news about Iraq."
U.S. exporters told Reuters Tuesday that Iraq on Monday night canceled 150,000 tonnes of HRW wheat and switched the purchase to Australian hard wheat.
Wheat also drew pressure from increased moisture in western Kansas, which should help the crop rebound from a damaging freeze that hit in April.
Traders said losses were limited by commercial scale-down buying.
KCBT wheat settled 1-1/4 to 5-1/2 cents per bushel lower, with July down 1-1/2 cents at $3.82-1/2. September lost 2-3/4 cents and closed at $3.82-1/2.
Traders said E D & F man International was a featured player, buying 1.6 million July. FIMAT bull-spread 1.1 million July/Sept bushels at even money.
